member.name: IExplorerBrowser.Advise
member.summary: Initiates a connection with for event callbacks.
member.param: A pointer to the interface of the object to be advised of events.
When this method returns, contains a token that uniquely identifies the event listener. This allows several event listeners to be subscribed at a time.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.BrowseToIDList
member.summary: Browses to a pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL)
member.param: A pointer to a const (item identifier list) that specifies an object's location as the destination to navigate to. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Remarks.

param.name: uFlags
param.para: A flag that specifies the category of the pidl. This affects how navigation is accomplished. Must be the value zero, or a bitwise combination of the following values.
An absolute PIDL, relative to the desktop.
A relative PIDL, relative to the current folder.
Browse to the parent folder, ignore the PIDL.

Windows Vista and later. This flag indicates that any search text entered by a WordWheel (the Search box in Windows Explorer) should be preserved during this navigation, so that items at the new location are filtered in the same way they were filtered at the previous location.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.BrowseToObject
member.param: A pointer to an object to browse to. If the object cannot be browsed, an error value is returned.

param.name: uFlags
param.para: A flag that specifies the category of the pidl. This affects how navigation is accomplished. Must be the value zero, or a bitwise combination of the following values.
An absolute PIDL, relative to the desktop.
A relative PIDL, relative to the current folder.
Browse the parent folder, ignore the PIDL.

Windows Vista and later. This flag indicates that any search text entered by a WordWheel (the Search box in Windows Explorer) should be preserved during this navigation, so that items at the new location are filtered in the same way they were filtered at the previous location.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.Destroy
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.FillFromObject
member.summary: Creates a results folder and fills it with items.
member.param: An interface pointer on the source object that will fill the . This can be an or any object that can be used with .
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.GetCurrentView
member.summary: Gets an interface for the current view of the browser.
member.param: A reference to the desired interface ID.
When this method returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This will typically be , , , or a related interface.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.GetOptions
member.param: When this method returns, contains the current for the browser.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.Initialize
member.summary: Prepares the browser to be navigated.
member.param: A handle to the owner window or control.
A pointer to a that contains the coordinates of the bounding rectangle that the browser will occupy. The coordinates are relative to hwndParent.
A pointer to a structure that determines how the folder will be displayed in the view. If this parameter is NULL, then you must call ; otherwise, the default view settings for the folder are used.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.RemoveAll
member.summary: Removes all items from the results folder.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or E_UNEXPECTED if this method is called before a call to .

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.SetEmptyText
member.param: A pointer to a constant, null-terminated, Unicode string that contains the empty text.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.SetFolderSettings
member.summary: Sets the folder settings for the current view.
member.param: A pointer to a structure that contains the folder settings to be applied.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.SetOptions
member.param: One or more flags to be set.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.SetPropertyBag
member.summary: Sets the name of the property bag.
member.param: A pointer to a constant, null-terminated, Unicode string that contains the name of the property bag. View state information that is specific to the application of the client is stored (persisted) using this name.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.SetRect
member.summary: Sets the size and position of the view windows created by the browser.
member.param: A pointer to a handle. This parameter can be NULL.
The coordinates that the browser will occupy.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IExplorerBrowser.Unadvise
member.param: A connection token previously returned from . Identifies the connection to be terminated.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: IExplorerBrowser is a browser object that can be either navigated or that can host a view of a data object. As a full-featured browser object, it also supports an automatic travel log.
The Shell provides a default implementation of IExplorerBrowser as CLSID_ExplorerBrowser. Typically, a developer does not need to provide a custom implementation of this interface.

The Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) provides full samples that demonstrate the use of and interaction with IExplorerBrowser. Download the Explorer Browser Search Sample and the Explorer Browser Custom Contents Sample.
